title: Bug: Exception when changing batch size (e.g.: upsampling data / data augmentation)
body:
I have implemented a transformer to upsample the minority class in an imbalanced dataset. This changes the number of examples in the dataset.
When being used in a pipeline,  I get an exception.

Below is a toy example to illustrate

```
from neuraxle.base import BaseTransformer
from neuraxle.pipeline import Pipeline
from neuraxle.steps.output_handlers import InputAndOutputTransformerMixin, InputAndOutputTransformerWrapper


class DataDoubler(InputAndOutputTransformerMixin, BaseTransformer):
    def __init__(self):
        BaseTransformer.__init__(self)
        InputAndOutputTransformerMixin.__init__(self)

    def transform(self, data_inputs):
        di, eo = data_inputs
        return  di*2, eo*2


X = ['some', 'example', 'data']
y = [1,1,0]


pipeline = Pipeline([
    InputAndOutputTransformerWrapper(DataDoubler())
])


result = pipeline.fit_transform(X,y)
print(result)

```
 
When running this, i get 
```
d
  File "lib/python3.8/site-packages/neuraxle/steps/output_handlers.py", line 163, in _did_process
    raise AssertionError(
AssertionError: DataDoubler: Caching broken because there is a different len of current ids, and data inputs. Please use InputAndOutputTransformerWrapper if you plan to change the len of the data inputs.

```

This seems to be a bug, since i am using the wrapper the error is suggesting me to use.   I have also tried without the wrapper, and i get the same error.
